name: Ehsaas Foundation
mission: Ehsaas helps low income families to alleviate their poverty and suffering by taking care of their basic necessities of food, water, shelter, health, education and employment – all without compromising their dignity. In addition, Ehsaas also rapidly implements emergency humanitarian relief in areas that have been struck by calamity.
theoryOfChange: Ehsaas states it helps low income families alleviate poverty and suffering by taking care of basic necessities (food, water, shelter, health, education and employment) without compromising dignity, and rapidly implements emergency humanitarian relief after calamities.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.ehsaasfoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.ehsaasfoundation.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)

judge_issues.message: Expenses ($1,880,017) exceed revenue ($1,324,818) by 42% - may be drawing down reserves

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Ehsaas Foundation Inc shows good alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: Ehsaas Foundation Inc focuses on the relief of poverty and helping the poor in times of crisis.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and follows specific Zakat policies and asnaf categories.
The organization reported total revenue of $1,324,818, a program expense ratio of 87.8%, and 6.5 months of working capital.
The foundation offers various donation options for programs such as Ration, Qurbani, and Ramadan appeals.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its strong financial efficiency and religious alignment, though its total score is tempered by limited external data transparency.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party data availability resulting in low data confidence scores
Lack of detailed cost-per-beneficiary metrics to further validate impact depth

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors by offering Zakat-eligible programs and addressing urgent religious and cultural needs through Ramadan and Qurbani appeals [2][4]. Its focus on poverty relief in times of crisis aligns with high-priority charitable causes [1].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a direct service model with a total revenue of $1,324,818 and a strong program expense ratio of 87.8% [1][3]. While financial health is stable with 6.5 months of working capital, the lack of specific cost-per-beneficiary data limits a higher impact rating [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Ehsaas Foundation Inc provides critical poverty relief and crisis assistance through high-efficiency programming and Zakat-eligible initiatives.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 87.8% ensures the vast majority of funds reach those in need
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent per $1 raised
Maintains a stable financial cushion with 6.5 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: Ehsaas Foundation Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to the relief of poverty and helping the poor during times of crisis [1]. The foundation operates key humanitarian programs including Ration distribution, Qurbani, and a Ramadan Appeal, and is officially recognized as Zakat-eligible [2][4].

case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="12">low data confidence score (0.3)</cite> and the <cite id="7">low program expense ratio (87.8%)</cite> reported in the 2023 Form 990.

confidence.notes: Low confidence due to transparency gaps and reporting inconsistencies.

alignment.improvement: The charity could improve by <cite id="15">expanding services to more underserved geographies</cite> with limited existing nonprofit coverage.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the charity should <cite id="14">disclose full board member identities</cite> and publish independent audited financial statements.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service delivery rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: Ehsaas Foundation Inc provides critical poverty relief and crisis assistance through high-efficiency programming and Zakat-eligible initiatives.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize direct humanitarian aid in South Asia and seek a Zakat-eligible organization with zero fundraising overhead.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 100% of their donation is not spent on fundraising
Seeking to fulfill Zakat through direct poverty relief
Value organizations with a strong financial reserve for stability
giving_considerations: The organization is experiencing a revenue decline of -17.4%
Limited public data on specific impact outcomes and beneficiary numbers
Board governance details are not fully transparent
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who require rigorous third-party impact evaluations or those seeking highly transparent board governance records.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a clear theory of change but a lack of verified outcome tracking or external evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The charity creates impact through the direct distribution of food, water, and health services to impoverished communities.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that direct aid effectively breaks the cycle of poverty rather than providing only temporary relief.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="16">revenue decline of -17.4%</cite>, the organization has significant capacity to absorb new funding to restore program scales.

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="8">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 spent per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring that donor acquisition costs do not detract from the mission.
Ehsaas Foundation maintains <cite id="9">6.5 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing a robust cushion for emergency response.
The charity utilizes a <cite id="10">documented theory of change</cite> focused on direct service delivery to alleviate poverty.

strengths_deep_dive: Ehsaas Foundation's operational model is built on direct service delivery, which allows for immediate impact in crisis-affected regions. By maintaining <cite id="9">high levels of working capital</cite>, the foundation can sustain its <cite id="2">Water for Life and Health Services programs</cite> even during periods of revenue volatility. Furthermore, its <cite id="5">verified Zakat-eligible status</cite> and focus on <cite id="6">asnaf-specific distribution</cite> make it a reliable vehicle for Muslim donors seeking to fulfill religious obligations through established humanitarian channels.
rich_narrative.summary: Ehsaas Foundation Inc is a humanitarian organization focused on the <cite id="1">relief of poverty and helping the poor</cite> in times of crisis. The organization operates a diverse portfolio of direct service programs, including <cite id="2">Ramadan appeals, food distribution, and water projects</cite>, primarily serving vulnerable populations in <cite id="3">Pakistan, India, and Bangladesh</cite>. Financially, the foundation reported <cite id="4">total revenue of $1,324,818</cite> in its most recent tax filing, with a significant emphasis on direct aid delivery. The charity is <cite id="5">officially recognized as Zakat-eligible</cite>, maintaining a dedicated policy to ensure funds reach eligible asnaf categories such as the <cite id="6">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite>. While the organization demonstrates a <cite id="7">program expense ratio of 87.8%</cite> in its 2023 Form 990, other reporting metrics indicate a <cite id="8">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 spent per $1 raised</cite>, suggesting a lean internal operation focused on maximizing donor contributions for humanitarian relief.
